bibl.title: Letter from Alton P. Tisdel to Philip Showalter Hench, August 17, 1937

div1.p: Tisdel acknowledges receipt of payment and informs Hench that supplies of the Yellow Fever Commission report are exhausted.

div1.head: Letter from Alton P. Tisdel to Philip Showalter Hench, August 17, 1937
div1.opener:
mdk
UNITED STATE OF AMERICA
GOVERNMENT PRINTING OFFICE
UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT PRINTING OFFICE
WASHINGTON, D. C.
August 17, 1937.
OFFICE OF
SUPERINTENDENT OF DOCUMENTS
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
This will acknowledge receipt of your letter of August
12th enclosing check for 45¢ in payment for a copy of Senate Document 822,
61st Congress, 3d Session, Report of the Yellow Fever Commission.

I have to advise that every possible source was con-
tacted when your letter requesting a copy of this publication was received
and we considered ourselves very fortunate to locate even one copy. I feel
safe in saying, in view of this statement, that the publication has become
entirely exhausted from all sources.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, ALTON P. TISDEL
Superintendent of Documents. Ga
Dr. P. S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minn.
